block.p: Melissa Bryna Radin, an Internet executive, and David Jerald Goldstone, who prosecutes computer crime and software piracy cases for the Justice Department, are to be married today. Rabbi Alan Turetz will officiate in the courtyard of the Old City Hall in Boston.

The bride, 33, is the vice president for marketing of LifeMinders.com, a direct marketing company in Herndon, Va. She graduated from West Virginia Wesleyan College and received an M.B.A. degree from Babson College. She is a daughter of Dr. Eric L. Radin of Marion, Mass., and the late Tove P. Radin. Her father, an adjunct professor of orthopedics at Tufts Medical School in Boston, retired as the director of the bone and joint center at the Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit and a clinical professor of orthopedic surgery at the University of Michigan Medical School at Ann Arbor.

The bridegroom, 32, is a trial attorney in the Justice Department's computer crime and intellectual property section. He is also an adjunct professor of cyberspace law at Georgetown University and George Washington University law schools, in Washington. He received a bachelor's degree and a master's degree in computer science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and a law degree from Harvard University.

He is a son of Lee and Irving Goldstone of West Palm Beach, Fla. His mother, who is retired, taught the first grade at the Henry E. Kentopp School in East Orange, N.J. His father, also retired, was a reading teacher at Public School 11 in Passaic, N.J.
